com.github.mrgoro.interactivedata.api.chart.annotations

Annotation Type OperationDef


  • public @interface OperationDef
    Definition of a Operation combining a granularity and multiple functions that are used to reduce that data by grouping.
    Author:
    Philipp Schürmann

    • Required Element Summary

      Required Elements 
      Modifier and Type Required Element and Description
      java.lang.Class<?> fieldClass
      Type of the field the operation operates on.
      java.lang.String fieldName
      Name of the field the operation operates on.
      FunctionDef[] functions
      Definition of Functions.
      java.lang.Class<? extends Granularity<?,?>> granularity
      Class of the granularity the operations uses.

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      Option[] options
      Options of the operation.

    • Element Detail

      • fieldName

        public abstract java.lang.String fieldName
        Name of the field the operation operates on.
        Returns:
        Name of the field

      • fieldClass

        public abstract java.lang.Class<?> fieldClass
        Type of the field the operation operates on.

        Note that Operations do not support every type. See the documentation of the operation for more information about data types supported.

        Returns:
        Type of the field

      • granularity

        public abstract java.lang.Class<? extends Granularity<?,?>> granularity
        Class of the granularity the operations uses. Granularity classes must extend Granularity.

        The granularity specifies the type of grouping.

        Returns:
        Class of the granularity

      • functions

        public abstract FunctionDef[] functions
        Definition of Functions. Multiple functions can be specified.
        Returns:
        Array of function definitions
        See Also:
        FunctionDef

      • options

        public abstract Option[] options
        Options of the operation.

        Options are key value paris defined within Option annotation. These options are used to populate the options data object of the operations. See the documentation of the operation for more information of the available options each operation has.

        Options are optional and do not have to be set.

        Returns:
        Array of options
        Default:
        {}
